thread.title: Olly Murs, Emma Bunton and fellow stars get colourful for charity
thread.title_full: Olly Murs, Emma Bunton and fellow stars get colourful for charity

title: Olly Murs, Emma Bunton and fellow stars get colourful for charity
text:
Olly Murs, Emma Bunton and fellow stars get colourful for charity Olly Murs, Emma Bunton and fellow stars get colourful for charity 
Press Association 2014 / / National Entertainment News Share 
Olly Murs, Emma Bunton and Mark Wright are among the stars who donned bright headwear and clothes for charity. 
The trio were joined by Elijah Wood, Ed Sheeran, Ellie Goulding and Little Mix, who lent their support to Global’s Make Some Noise day. This year’s theme was “dress loud”. Elijah Wood takes on receptionist duties (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
X Factor host Olly donned a clashing Hawaiian outfit, as he posed for photos with Gold radio presenter Tony Dibbin, while Emma – a presenter on Heart – wore a huge bow on her head. 
Olly’s mission was to crash all eight of Global’s stations in an hour – Capital Xtra, Radio X, Classic FM, LBC, Heart, Gold, Smooth and Capital. Olly Murs and Tony Dibbin (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
Mark, who is married to actress Michelle Keegan, had a suitably loud top. Mark Wright (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
Kate Garraway and Aled Jones also picked out some interesting headgear. Kate Garraway, Olly Murs and Richard Arnold (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) Aled Jones goes red (Daniel Leal-Olivas/PA) 
Australian boyband 5 Seconds Of Summer created and designed their own headwear. The @5SOS boys have designed us these fab caps to support #DressLoud today! Thanks for helping us #MakeSomeNoise pic.twitter.com/g92DmtH14F 
— Make Some Noise (@makenoise) October 8, 2015 
Thinking Out Loud singer Ed surprised a fan, who has acute lymphoblastic leukaemia. Here's what happened when @EdSheeran surprised one of the teens supported by #MakeSomeNoise http://t.co/TGrEhsy15F pic.twitter.com/OSz7R15MhL 
— Make Some Noise (@makenoise) October 8, 2015 
The charity day raised nearly £2 million for Make Some Noise. Thank you again for helping us to raise £1,955,869 for disadvantaged children and young people across the UK! pic.twitter.com/UTbLup8hJy Share article 
— Make Some Noise (@makenoise) October 9, 2015 Promoted Stories
